metadata.feature_description: Integrate Disqus commenting system for post discussions

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Connectors in PersonaBar
steps.expected: Connectors page loads showing all available connectors
steps.actual: Connectors page loaded successfully showing all connectors including Disqus

steps.expected: Disqus connector shows its configuration status
steps.actual: Disqus connector shows 'Connect' button (indicating not configured), while configured connectors like Google Analytics 4 show 'Edit' button

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Display Disqus comments on post detail

steps.action: Navigate to News page with Publisher posts
steps.expected: News page loads with published posts
steps.actual: News page loaded successfully showing published posts including 'Publisher Test Post'

steps.action: Click on 'Publisher Test Post' to view post detail
steps.expected: Post detail page loads with post content and Disqus comments section
steps.actual: Post detail page loads showing title, date, body, author, and share links, but NO Disqus comments section is displayed

steps.action: Scroll to verify comments section exists
steps.expected: Disqus comments section with 'disqus_thread' div should appear after author section
steps.actual: Page goes directly from 'Share this post' section to footer. No comments section exists on the page.

issues: Disqus comments section does not appear because Disqus connector is not configured
Code review confirms: ShowComments requires _disqusManager.HasBeenConfigured to be true (Detail.ascx.cs line 116-119)
Feature requires external Disqus API credentials (shortname and public API key) to function

observations: Code review of Detail.ascx.cs shows ShowComments = !Globals.IsEditMode() && Post.AllowedComments && Post.Published && _disqusManager.HasBeenConfigured
The Disqus comments feature is properly implemented in code (Detail.ascx lines 76-106) with disqus_thread div and embed script
DisqusManager.js handles new comment notifications via NotifyAboutNewComment API call
Disqus connector (DisqusConnector.cs) requires two settings: shortname and public API key
Without valid Disqus API credentials, the feature cannot be tested beyond verifying connector status
This is an external dependency issue - the feature integration code exists and appears correct, but cannot be activated without third-party API setup
